sense.name: 1.094 yards
sense.commentary: the basic unit of length adopted under the Systeme International d'Unites (approximately 1.094 yards)
sense.examples: Don't worry his water gun can't squirt farther than one meter. The smoker ran almost six meters before he began panting.

sense.name: unit for measuring
sense.commentary: any of various measuring instruments for measuring a quantity
sense.examples: I should go back, I didn't put enough money in the parking meter.

sense.name: beat
sense.commentary: metre, measure, beat, cadence -prosody - the accent in a metrical foot of verse
sense.examples: In French poetry , meter is determined solely by the number of syllables in a line.

sense.name: rhythm
sense.commentary: metre, time -rhythm as given by division into parts of equal time
sense.examples: The irregular meter was comprised of patterns of beats of different lengths.
